DataElement.preferredName: Additional Pathology Pancreatic Intraepithelial Neoplasia Finding Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field for the additional pathologic findings related to pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIN) is a recently adopted term to describe precancerous pancreatic duct lesions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Pathology Pancreatic Intraepithelial Neoplasia Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to additional pathologic findings related to pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIN) is a recently adopted term to describe precancerous pancreatic duct lesions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PanIN) is a recently adopted term to describe precancerous pancreatic duct lesions. --2002:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: A pre-cancerous, non-invasive pancreatic epithelial neoplasm that arises from and is confined to the pancreatic ducts.  It is a papillary or flat neoplasm that usually measures less than 5 mm in diameter.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.
